publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5363 Gil Paterson: Nuclear Waste at Dounreay, Now You See It, Now You Don’t—That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Environment Protection Agency, the nuclear regulator, to fully investigate the circumstances surrounding the reappearance of part of the 170kg of enriched uranium that was first reported as being lost and then reported as an accountancy error in that the material was not missing but never existed in the first place; further calls for those in authority who are responsible for public announcements on decommissioning at Dounreay to stop spinning stories after the fact that infer that highly enriched uranium, which is not accounted for nor can be found, is in any event safe, and expects them to clean up not only nuclear waste but also their public announcements. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S3M-5363 Nuclear Waste at Dounreay, Now You See It, Now You Don’t (lodged on 7 December 2009) Bob Doris*, Christopher Harvie*, Bill Kidd*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Brian Adam*, Bill Wilson*, Robin Harper*
S3M-5363 Nuclear Waste at Dounreay, Now You See It, Now You Don’t (lodged on 7 December 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Stuart McMillan*
S3M-5363 Nuclear Waste at Dounreay, Now You See It, Now You Don’t (lodged on 7 December 2009) Sandra White*, Christina McKelvie*

S3M-5363 Gil Paterson: Nuclear Waste at Dounreay, Now You See It, Now You Don’t—That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Environment Protection Agency, the nuclear regulator, to fully investigate the circumstances surrounding the reappearance of part of the 170kg of enriched uranium that was first reported as being lost and then reported as an accountancy error in that the material was not missing but never existed in the first place; further calls for those in authority who are responsible for public announcements on decommissioning at Dounreay to stop spinning stories after the fact that infer that highly enriched uranium, which is not accounted for nor can be found, is in any event safe, and expects them to clean up not only nuclear waste but also their public announcements. Supported by: Bob Doris, Christopher Harvie, Bill Kidd, Joe FitzPatrick, Brian Adam, Bill Wilson, Robin Harper, Jamie Hepburn, Stuart McMillan, Sandra White, Christina McKelvie, Michael Matheson*
S3M-5363 Nuclear Waste at Dounreay, Now You See It, Now You Don’t (lodged on 7 December 2009) Christine Grahame*
S3M-5363 Nuclear Waste at Dounreay, Now You See It, Now You Don’t (lodged on 7 December 2009) Angela Constance*
S3M-5363 Nuclear Waste at Dounreay, Now You See It, Now You Don’t (lodged on 7 December 2009) Dave Thompson*
